comments.author: wvegter@xsinet.co.za
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

When opening multiple tabs, the previous version of Firefox indicated the point of origin, i.e. when you middle-clicked an entry to open it in a new tab, that entry would be highlighted by a small box around the entry. This does not happen anymore, which means one has to remember which entry has been middle-clicked last in a long list of entries which I wish to open all in separate tabs. That's very inconvenient.

Reproducible: Always

comments.raw_text: I'm the link last middle-clicked is meant to have a focus ring around it after you switch back to it from another tab, but not until then.
